title: BlackSky looks to expand its military business amid growing interest in commercial satellite imagery
summary: Amid a surge in demand for satellite imagery, BlackSky is looking to expand its national security and defense business.

title: Private astronaut mission cleared for launch
summary: The first commercial mission by an American spacecraft to the International Space Station is ready for launch as a pathfinder for a new era of commercial orbital human spaceflight.

title: Astroscale to restart debris-removal demo with half the thrusters
summary: Astroscale plans to resume an attempt to capture a satellite acting as a piece of debris in low Earth orbit despite losing half the servicer’s eight thrusters.

title: NASA Awards Contract for Modeling, Simulation Capabilities to ANSYS
summary: NASA has awarded ANSYS Inc of Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, a contract to provide a suite of modeling and simulation tools including capabilities in the following engineering disciplines: structures, crash, thermal, fluids, photonics, semiconductors, electromagnetics, materials, mission, test, evaluation, and orbit determination.

title: Getting a jump on traffic: The sudden urgency of government-industry partnerships in space traffic management
summary: There is a trend of growing private sector capabilities to track objects and warn of potential conjunctions.
